FileProcessor
public abstract class AbstractFileProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileProcessor

Abstract implementation of the file processor interface.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

processFile

public final void processFile(java.io.File input,
                              java.io.File output,
                              java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean die)
Process the input file.

This implementation takes care to always call the closeOutputStream method if openOutputStream returns a non-null stream. IOExceptions are caught and wrapped in an IllegalStateException.

Specified by:
processFile in interface FileProcessor
Parameters:
input - A file handle to the input to be processed.
output - A file handle to the output to be collected (possibly null).
die - A value that may turn true during processing, indicating that the processing should be aborted.
